data.meta_site_name: The One Wiki to Rule Them All
data.text:
Marton Csokas (born 30 June 1966 in Invercargill, New Zealand) is a Kiwi actor, most famous for his portrayal of Celeborn.

His surname is pronounced "Cho-Kash".

Life[]

Csokas was born the son of a Kiwi mother and a Hungarian-born father, also named Márton Csókás. He graduated from the New Zealand Drama School in 1989.

Trivia[]

He appeared in the 2000 film The Monkey's Mask, which also featured John Noble.

He had a voice role in the 2002 film Star Wars: Episode II - Attack of the Clones, which also featured Christopher Lee and Anthony Daniels.

He appeared in the 2003 film Timeline, which also featured Billy Connolly.

He appeared in the 2004 film The Bourne Supremacy, which also featured Karl Urban.

He appeared in the 2005 film Kingdom of Heaven, which also featured Orlando Bloom.

He appeared in the 2005 film Asylum, which also featured Ian McKellen.

He appeared in the 2010 film Alice in Wonderland, which also featured the voices of Christopher Lee and Stephen Fry.

He appeared in the 2010 film South Solitary, which also featured Miranda Otto.

He appeared in the 2014 film The Equalizer, which also featured Sala Baker.
